intro: Chaerophyllum hirsutum var. glabratum, commonly known as the smooth hogweed, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems are generally smooth and hairless, distinguishing it from the more hairy form of the species. It produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
